name: Arun Siddharth Konagurthu
content: Arun Konagurthu - Monash University View Scopus Profile Arun Konagurthu Assoc Professor Associate Professor, Department of Data Science & AI https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1610-8329 EmailArun.Konagurthumonashedu Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectshttps://supervisorconnect.it.monash.edu/ 20042025 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyArun Konagurthu is a continuing academic at Monash University, since 2010. He currently serves as the Director of Graduate Research in the Department of Data Science and AI. Between 2016-2019 he served as the Director of the undergraduate Bachelor of Computer Science Degree offered by Monash. Between 2011-2013, he held a Larkins Fellowship at this faculty. Prior to that he held an Eberly College of Science postdoctoral Fellowship at the Pennsylvania State University. His primary research area is Computational Biology and Bioinformatics, statistical learning and information theory. His academic home page is maintained at: http://lcb.infotech.monash.edu.au/~karun His research lab page is maintained at: http://lcb.infotech.monash.edu.au Monash teaching commitmentDr Arun Konagurthu has experience as the Chief Examiner for the following units in the Faculty of IT: FIT3155 Advanced data structures and algorithms (2018- to date)FIT2004 Algorithms and data structures (2014-2017)FIT3139 Computational science (2011-2017) Arun has experience as the Lecturer for the following units in the Faculty of IT: FIT3155 Advanced data structures and algorithms (2018 - to date)FIT2004 Algorithms and data structures (2014-2017)FIT3139 Computational science (2011-2017)FIT4012 Advanced topics in computational science (2016) Education/Academic qualificationComputer Science, Doctor of Philosophy, University of MelbourneAward Date: 15 Jan 2007 Research area keywordsBioinformaticsComputational Biologystatistical learning theoryAlgorithmsInformation Theory Projects Projects per year 2012 2012 2015 2020 2021 3 Finished Projects per year Modelling, synthesis and testing of potential agents against COVID-19 main proteaseKonagurthu, A.
